Dee :-)

--- In junit@y..., Joi Ellis <joi@a...> wrote:
> On Wed, 2 May 2001, Dee Hauer wrote:
> 
> > Hello,
> >   I am currently running a Master Suite test which runs every 
test on our
> > system.  I am including a print screen of how JUnit is displaying 
the
> > hierarchy.....Is there a way to give the suites a different name 
other than
> > 'junit.framework.TestSuite@2cb158'.  I have searched through the 
archive,
> > but can't seem to find how to do this.  Does anyone have any 
ideas?? 
> 
> Give the test suite a name when you create it.
> 
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("com.aravox.util");
> suite.add(com.aravox.util.AllTests.class);
> 
> If you use the reflection form, the suite's name becomes the name of
> the test class you passed in.
> 
> -- 
> Joi Ellis                    Software Engineer
> Aravox Technologies          joi@a..., gyles19@v...
> 
> No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one 
thing I
> really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried.  Anything
> that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
>            - Chris Johnson
subject: Re: Test Suite labeling....
